DoorCode.title: DoorCode
DoorCode.description: Represents a door code for a specific property.

id.description: Unique identifier for the DoorCode entity.

location.description: The physical location of the door (e.g., 'Front Door', 'Garage').

lastChanged.description: The date and time the door code was last changed.

definition.description: Stores door codes for a specific user. Path-based ownership ensures only the authenticated user can access their own door codes.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user.

params.name: doorCodeId
params.description: The unique identifier of the door code.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to store door codes associated with properties. It follows the principle of path-based ownership under each user. Each user has their own collection of door codes, enabling easy management and security rule creation. The structure prioritizes Authorization Independence, avoiding complex `get()` calls in security rules by ensuring that authorization context is directly tied to the user ID derived from authentication.  The path `/users/{userId}/door_codes/{doorCodeId}` uses hierarchical paths for user-owned data, which provides clarity and consistency, as well as makes it easy to create ownership-based security rules. This structure also facilitates secure `list` operations by scoping door codes to individual users.
